name: Shank
description: Shank is the cult-classic revival of the sidescrolling beat-em-up. Play as Shank in an over-the-top grindhouse game, packed to the rim with enemies, bosses, combos, and more by the award-winning team at Klei Entertainment.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7 Processor:Intel Pentium 4 running at 1.7 GHz or Greater; Athlon 64 running at 1.7GHz or greater with support for SSE2 instructions Memory:1 GB of ram, 1.5 GB (Vista and Windows 7) GB RAM Graphics:ATI Radeon X1800 GTO 256MB and the Nvidia GeForce 6800 Ultra 256MB cards DirectX®:9.0 Hard Drive:2 GB HD space

reviews.review_text: Shank is a cheesy 2D platformer & beat'em up game that plays in Mexico. It has it's own graphic style. There's a little bit gore and brutal scenes especially on the boss kills. You start with 3 different weapon classes, melee = chainsaw (yeah!) double pistols (akimbo style, you can fly during shooting in the air because of recoil wtf?) and 2 daggers to pounce on enemies. Somehow the movements and controls are a little bit clunky. I even experienced some lags with over 300 FPS.  The big plus is the strange atmosphere. The background music supports it much and feels like a neverending Quentin Tarantino soundtrack. The big minus are the controls and fights. Enemies are able to block gunshots and can dogde around you in the background. Mostly the gameplay is like in Double Dragon. (you can also finish a just local co-op campaign). Enemies with ridiculous names appear from both sides and you have fight them down to proceed. You can pickup some powerups (grenades, health) or special weapons (grenade launcher, flamethrower) but it's just rarely.  The hard mode is really very hard. Even if you manage to kill properly all enemies on the map. There remain these annoying jump sequences. Once you fall down you have to repeat the whole level (in hard mode there are no savepoints). Or you just get hit by a grenade on the slackline or accidently change sides on a climbing pole. Sometimes windows don't break if you try to jump through ...

“When you're pushed, killing is as easy as breathing.”    Shank is an entertaining 2-D brawler game with a robust combat system and visuals that cross a cartoonish look with the grittiness of graphic novels. The variety of weapons will give you several ways to finish off your opponents, and the boss battles are well made and enjoyable.   You should also take a look into the cooperative game, because it provides a decent background story for the singleplayer campaign.  Overall the game offers solid gameplay, fluid controls and visceral combat.    Achievements:    Estimated time for 100 % completion: +8 hours  Singleplayer achievements: 11 Multiplayer achievements: 1    Chronology:    Shank 2 (PC)  2-D platformer + beat-em-up (Action) – 2012   Link to Steam review for Shank 2.    Shank (PC)  2-D platformer + beat-em-up (Action) – 2010

This game... It's just amazing!  I love how you can just strangle your enemies with chains to kill them ;)  It has a lot of gore and it is really entertaining to watch.. THOUGH SOME SCENES WERE CUT OUT OF THE GAME !! >:/ Also it's just a 4 hour game even if you play slowly! D:  But still everyone has to atleast try this game!  10/10 I would recommend it.
WICKED FUN!! The best 10 dollars I ever spend on STEAM!! Look forward to Shank 2.
Kinda short but otherwise really fun.

By the time of this late review, you've probably have already made your mind about this nearly 3 year old game. I'm simply reviewing to state my interpretation. Shank is a revenge tale played in a 2D platforming brawler. Gameplay is somewhat comparble to the Devil May Cry series, with a standard attack, a secondary weapon attack and guns that can be switched on the fly, grapple and pounce moves, and a grenade to cause heavy damage. The combat is pretty simplistic, and often spammy, as mashing the standard attacks is sometimes the best way to deal with single enemies and small groups. That isn't to say there isn't some complexity with the fact that some enemies can shoot from afar, block or dodge your attacks, or perform unblockable power attacks. The majority of the combat boils down to managing gun shooters and grenade throwers while a handful of standard grunts and a 'big guy' or two that require you to dodge or block their attacks. Platform segments are simple and are nearly automatic, but can become a little annoying when you miss a grab point or are hit by a projectile mid-jump.  The game's simplicity is both it's main pro and con - it's a simple, very short story with easy to grasp controls and enjoyable 'mindless bloodshed'. It also means the game becomes fairly predictable and leaves most the game easily beat by 'spamming main attack' or 'spamming pistols' until you win (this will not always work though, and it pays to mix it up on tougher enemies and large groups). I beat it in less than 3 hours, which is crazy short, but I'm also perfectly fine with that because any longer probably would have outstayed it's welcome for me. (another backlogged title defeated!).  You won't find the new revolution in brawlers here, but you have a solid action title that's enjoyably mindless.
Very good original action with non stop furious gameplay and dramatic story. Must play. 9.5 out of 10.
Very stabby.
Hard Mode: tougher enemies and no checkpoints! 'Hard', yeah, right... I would call it 'Welcome back to 90's', nothing more! Piece and cake...

A great platform archade game in the same vein as the old classics like contra, double dragon etc. The bosses are a bit pain to kill cause of the use of quick time events triggered by doing specific combos. Wholly recommended.

Average beat'em up if you ask me. I always heard good things about Shank and I also played another Klei games such as Mark of the Ninja and Don't Starve and I really enjoyed those but, I'm afraid I cannot said the same about this one. It just felt like and old school beat'em up, not that that it's a bad thing but I was disapointed by this one, probably if I had played this before played Mark of the Ninja I wouldn't be expecting more from Klei since it came before Mark of the Ninja. Fun game none the less but I dare to say it's not worth the full price in my honest opinion.

Shank reminds me a bit of the old school beat'em ups that were the craze in the late 80's and early 90's. While good fun for the first couple stages, it becomes very repetitive and unengaging. Thankfully it was very brief and has some amazing artwork and animation.
Mindless Bloody Sidescrolling Fun
Old school indie side scrolling frenetic beat em up. Back in the day this would of been a major release and sold in a Chinatown import store for $60.
Fantastic Indie Game.... just what you need
Very fun and violent little action packed game. Full of nice combos and combat, and very bloody!

A number of Steam reviews, which I can only hope/presume have been written by exceedingly YOUNG people, seem to refer to the similarities between this game and a very recent movie series going by the name of 'Machete'. These kids clearly need to track down some OLDER films - not to mention read some comics (y'know, those things they used to make with PAPER) - and generally catch up on their 'grindhouse' and 'exploitation' history a little.    First of all, before Robert Rodriguez got involved with Machete, there was Grindhouse, in which there was a fake PREVIEW for Machete. Before that, he directed a little film (which bears an equal amount of similarity to this game) called Desperado. THAT was a sequel-of-sorts to his very modest FIRST film, called El Mariachi. We could then go on to mention that some guy named Quentin Tarantino started making (by-and-largely BETTER) films around the same time of somewhat same-ish ilk, and if we REALLY wanted to get pedantic we could acknowledge that there have in fact been DECADES full of movies directed by guys with names like John Woo and Sam Peckinpah without whom, let's face it, NONE OF THIS would have existed. Oh, and then there's comic writers and artists like Frank Miller, who not only co-directed the film adaptation of his Sin City comics (with a certain aforementioned Rodriguez character), but whose distinctive silhouetted-action art-style (which he's been doing for decades) is co-opted more than once in the course of...THIS VERY GAME! Which we should probably start talking about, in all fairness (since this is supposed to be a review of it an' all). SO ENOUGH WITH THE MACHETE REFERENCES ALREADY, OKAY?! The SEVENTIES were FULL of movies which could just as readily be cited as influences to this game. And action anti-heroes were rapidly firing twin pistols back in the EIGHTIES, boys and girls, in ASIAN movies no less! Anyway, enough geriatric ranting, on with the review.    Shank is good. REAL good. And kinda hard. Sometimes REAL hard. But is it unique? No. Just as its INFLUENCES (see last paragraph, just in case you missed it) aren't exactly brand-new, neither is the gameplay. But is there anything wrong with this, when the game is by-and-largely good old-fashioned 2D side-scrolling beat-'em-up FUN?! OF COURSE THERE ISN'T!! I mean, I don't play many of these games these days, but just 'cause an idea is OLD doesn't mean it's inherently 'bad'. Sure, it adds some SEMI-modernisms, like oodles of bloodshed and endearingly cartoonish visuals, but it's basically the same-old, same-old, albiet done WELL. And there ain't nuthin' wrong with that in MY book. Apart from some slightly ♥♥♥♥♥♥/awkward platforming bits and a baffling inability to assign any of the buttons to the mouse if you choose to play with keyboard, there really isn't that much to complain about.     Well, okay, one thing. I actually got the ♥♥♥♥♥ and threw in the towel on the chapter immediately preceding the final boss battle, because I honestly do lack the patience these days to keep fighting the same twenty-seven guys over and over and over again in order to yet yet again reach that one bit where I keep dying, and the game's sudden, stubborn lack of check-points was forcing me to do just that. Like I mentioned above, I'm gettin' old, so 'beating' the VAST MAJORITY of the game is good enough for me, in all honesty. A quick peek at a video walkthrough confirms that I didn't miss much, anyway. Like I said...nothing truly new and ground-breaking here, but very solid entertainment for anyone with the patience and skillz (dat's skillz wit' a Z, ya'll) to see it through. Guess I should try the sequel some time, too...    Verdict: 8.5/10.
This game is the best Indie Action game! Pretty good graphics, low price, cool story of revenge... What can you want more?

(Normal peeps killed) Kill some guys with guns Kill some guys with knifes Kill some guys with machetes Kill some guys with AK-47's Kill some guys with M4A1 KIll some big guys with grenade launchers KIll some big guys with fists KIll some big guys with bid bodies KIll some big guys with minigun KIll some girls with katana KIll some girls with smg  (Big Bosses) Kill a girl with scar Kill a masochist man that pulls his nipple for erection buff power Kill a human-bomb charging psycho rhinocerous Kill your own headmaster Kill a butcher Kill another guy Kill some more bosses Kill a priest that kills people by electrocuting it  (Misc injuries) A man with a sliced off arm that offered to Jesus Christ  Some guys were pushed off roof,cliffed,into the fire,onto the road during at a truck,tank and bombs Some guys were shot about 12-16 bullets in the chest sent flying  (Pros) Combo like bloody epic Dante,fly like Dante,and shoot pistols like dante,namely evily and irony (Dante is a character from devil may cry's series and his guns are named Ebony and Ivory) Can wall jump,wall climb,wall run,wall slide and F*ck people up (Screw Spiderman) Different weapons for the win Different style of combos with weapons Grenades are op Nice Music Nice arts Nice Animation  (Cons) Shotgun sucks Unable to use chain to spank and whip people A regular health that is not enough to win (Namely cause we die a lot in it,unless you're a mlg playa) During climbing,on a thin pipe,you'll easily fall and have to repeat jump climb  That is all Buy this game to help Klei Entertainments Buy this game to help Steam Buy this game to support Shank in killing more people Buy this game to support our lord and savior G.A.B.E.N. in making Half-Life 3 and Shank 3
If you enjoy the occasional side scroller beat em up, you can't get much better than this. The graphics are well done, the moves are over the top, and the gore makes you laugh. Great Game.

Short but sweet. This is the best beat em up game I've played since Streets of Rage. The grindhouse aesthetic combined with the smooth fluid controls (gamepad) make for an amazing experience. If you like grindhouse style movies, you'll love this game. I don't think I stopped smiling once throughout my 3 hr playthrough. A few minor gripes, but nothing worth mentioning as the game is just so damn fun =P

Short but sweet. This is the best beat em up game I've played since Streets of Rage. The grindhouse aesthetic combined with the smooth fluid controls (gamepad) make for an amazing experience. If you like grindhouse style movies, you'll love this game. I don't think I stopped smiling once throughout my 3 hr playthrough. A few minor gripes, but nothing worth mentioning as the game is just so damn fun =P

A good beat-em-up game with cool graphics and nice controls (controller is almost a requirement). Very violent and gory (although cartoony) and reminiscent of revenge movies.  It is a little repetitive, the boss fights are kind of easy and the game is fairly short but I'd recommend it to fans of the genre.  6/10

I honestly do not understand how I use to play this game for free and now I bought it because I don't want to pirate and I paid that much money for the game again and all the scenes are cut!!! I recommend the game because it is very nice but If you can pirate and download it from somewhere do so!!! All the scenes are cut because steam is trash!
Great game, highly recommended!
This was quite fun. I should play more someday.
Thiis game brings me back to playing old platforming dames on the gamenoy. I give it a 12 out of 10.

A very fluent 2D style beat em up with alot of heart and blood flowing action. While the fight system can get repetitive they add in new elements and weapons to keep you invested. Defenitley a good buy. Not to mention an ok story to boot. Shank gets a 8.5/10
Shank baby! fight and Slash your way the way to the end in style.
Playing this game makes you a homo according to Sharia Law

This takes me back to my mega drive and snes platform shoot em up days. I loved platform shoot em ups (Flashback, empire strikes back, judge dredd and Alien 3 being some of the classics)and this chucks into the genre loads of gore, quality weapons and gnarley hand to hand combat. The bosses are hardcore and the character movement and jumping is tasty. I am a big fan of the flash graphics. It might be a little short lived for some.

Great game. I wasn't expecting much, but the gameplay is actually fun and the art style is nice. It's a nice mix of platforming and beat'em up. It's rather short though, so you probably want to get it in a humble bundle or during a sale.  8 / 10

One word, Kickass!!! I used to be fan of Double Dragon, Mighty Final Fight, Streets of Rage and Contra in childhood... and this game my friends pays homage to all of those. If you like good beat-em-ups and Contra-esque games absolutely give this a try. It is a gem. 10/10  Great Mechanics and precise controls, huge variety among goons to beat, well designed Bosses (not really tough but challengin enough), Lots of cool kill styles. Story brings things together very well for a game of this genere. Cutscenes and dialogues are well written.  10/10 would Shank!!! B)

I wanted this game the second I first heard of it. It's the classic story of betrayal and revenge with tons of hack and slash action as you take on hordes oh bad guys.  The game is lots of fun and has good replay value with co-op and things to unlock like new costumes.  I loved it and can't wait for Shank 2 to come out.

This is a pretty fun side-scrolling beat-'em-up. The combat is visceral and well-designed with a very fluid flow to it. There is also a co-op mode for 2 players with a different story and boss fights that actually require cooperation. The only downside to this game is that the story is immature and stupid. But the gameplay is really fun so that's not a big deal.

Main thing I have to say is Shank has been censored since its original release, which was a bit dissapointing to discover. Other than that; Shank is a great little beat 'em up, short on easy mode but tough on hard so just as it should be really. If you get it for under £3 like I did, it's a bargain.
Great game, Nice art style, but short
Fun and short platformer with neat visuals. Coop is alright.
Really entertaining, but short beat 'em up. Can recommend for about two to three hours of bloody fun!
Hard as hell, but an amazing game. Just dont try to play it without a controller
Sidescroller action, blood and guts everywhere, great combos and great cartoon graphics, just play it, it will not disappoint you.

this game is fun, but don't button mash a flying chansaw strik into enemies or you'll get stuck in the air and you'll have to load last checkpoint. played for 20 official minutes and had it happen multiple times. you have been warned
knife is a good patforager where you stab people its good too
This game is about as awesome as side-scollers get.
Fun, gory and looooots of blood....well it's a bit frustrating without a controller but if you get used to a keyboard you'll cut a lot of skin!

Hardcore, Brutal, and Raw. One of best platform action game. Full with maxican art style, horde of enemies and deadly bosses, killing combo with smooth animations. Plus, enjoy coop game with your friend. Try once now!
Great game think about Kill Bill: Volume 1's story, then add a great platformer that's very violent and bloody, put in some great controls, a bunch of combos and voilá you got Shank. 100% Recommended

Old-school 2D side-scroller beat-'em-up (or more aptly slash/shoot-'em-up in this case) with a blood-soaked pulp sensibility that'll probably make you think of Robert Rodriguez. Good clean dirty fun.  Oh, except some retroactive censorship got laid on a couple things. It's probably not enough to bug you unless you got to play the real version first, but it's worth looking for a fix for IMO.

Shank its a fantasic game, the easy mode its really fair, the bosses a not really hard then you know there mechanic.....only the hard mode can be unfair then you hit by a rocket or something and falling in the dead.. Then you really near on the end of a level and you falling in the dead, something has hit you and you can cry. Maybe only level 5 has this problem. Cant wait to see Shank 2 in Steam and playing it too....ah one bad thing Shank has no Online-Mode for the Co-Op play...

The game was alright. It's pretty straight forward, kill stuff and get through obstacles. The weapons were pretty cool. I liked the animation of the characters. The enemy characters were just painted differently, with each level. They were also pretty cheap. The backgrounds weren't very full of lifeThe platforming wasn't very hard. I liked where they were going with the combat, but it seemed like they didn't go into it any deeper. The animation was solid. It's not very long. It's a meciocre game, overall.
It's like Streets of Rage except with more stabbing.
Revenge-The Game(now with Co-Op!)
Robert Rodriguez by way of Newgrounds.

Solid side-scroller/brawling. Multiple weapons and a decent amount of variety in the brawling along with a cool art style. Gory if that's your thing.  Combat could get frusterating especially when you don't learn how to dodge until near the end of the game -_-. Story was basically a straight rip of a certain Quentin Tarantino movie. Platforming was super meh, might as well have been QTE's. Lastly, game is fairly short... took me 4 hours or so for just the SP, no idea about the coop and will probably be some time before I get around to playing it

Why aren't more games like Shank? The 2-d brilliance is one of the best things that the video game industry has going for it, the indie market should be full of them, but no, Shank and an Xbox title in desperate need of a PC port called the Dishwasher are the only ones I could find. The game itself is full of great combos, kill mechainics and one-liners so hilarious and awful it's amazing that it wasn't the first draft.

Shank is a great side scrolling action game with awesome art work and fun gameplay.  There isn't much in the way of a story but it's not really needed for this game. I recommend picking it up if you're looking to kill some time.
Platforming was weak, and combat can be kind of hacked. Bosses don't show a lot of variety or interest, but as a button mashing is good.

Shank 1 is a fun side scrolling beat 'em up with a simple but interesting plot that moves you forward through cast of prior Grievances. Its a bit on the short side but its length keeps it from becoming dull.
Great indie game thus far for those who love some button mashing action.(Gaming controller is recommnded)
Great co op beat m up for a great price. You knew this already.

Only in Shank can I fight mexican wrestlers, blow up viehcles, kill ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and fetish fuelled giants, whislt stabbing a juggernaut with a chainsaw! Cartoon violence with the shlock movie esque plot...and it has co-op!
Violence, scrolling, and chainsaws.  Very fun game it felt extremely short i miss the days of SNES fighters that felt almost endless. Would Chainsaw kill again 8/10
It's quite fun to play this. I usually don't play games like this, but this one really caught on after few minutes. I like both the story and gameplay.  I rate it a 7 hit combo out of 10.
Really good platformer.  +Lots of weapons and enemies +Original and memorable bosses +Fully animated scenes +Local Multiplayer with its own story. +Amazing soundtrack -short, I guess

There are two bad things about Steam version of Shank: 1. Controls are not perfect. This is not a big problem. Controls work good with Xbox controller, but it could be better. 2. Lot of cutscenes material is missing for no apparent reason.  If you go past that, Shank is really fun action game. Nice graphics, lots of blood and guts, 2D brawler made for modern age. You go right, jump, hack, shout and punch hordes of enemies. There is 20 single player levels for about 4-6 hours of gameplay and 2 player local co-op (2 controllers) for another 3-5 hours. It is a bit short but it is long enough not to become repetitive in a bad way. So I recommend it for a nice and violent weekend.
Killer Game! FULL control with X-Box Controller

Shank is a 2D Sidescrolling beat-em-up. You have a small arsenal on hand that you use to dispatch your enemies in brutal bloody fast paced combat. Its fun and its got a tacky but well done story. A revenge flick style beat em up. Klei even in their earlier days were a force to be reckoned with. Play this game, especially if it goes on sale, because it will be super cheap!

Maybe this game is great but my xbox one controller desn't work. The controller layout is all mesed up. I can reconfigure it but in the menus it's still using a ret.arded layout, like press down to validate. Im using a Mac. Apparently people using Windows have even worse issues with xbx1 controller.

Recommended for anyone craving a quick beat em' up, preferably with a friend. Had got some nice combat, satisfying when pulling off combos, and the enemies change up your dominant strategy, but nothing exciting or standing out. A forgettable story, which is forgivable for beat em ups.    Would recommend Shank and Shank 2 together if you find a good deal for them.
Take all the worst parts of the beat-em-up arcade genre and mash them into a single game. Shank.
Boring and repetitive. Feels drawn out even at only two or three hours long. The enviornments and art look great, but the beat em-up combat needs a lot more polish.
Buggy and repetetive as hell. I suppose it's a decent game if you really love side scrolling beat'em ups though.

This isnt a terrible game, and to a certain degree it is fun but the controls are somewhat stiff and it always feels like you are being held back by the controls, that with better controls you could have more fun because you could do amazing combos and such. However my biggest problem with the game is the story, i dont like how linear the story is, i dont like how it has no real originality and the 'plot twist' if you could call it that at the end, was not surpising, at all, I guessed the plot twist as it happened. while the gameplay to me is okay, thoughout most of the game I'm not sure why Shank is doing what he is doing, i dont know who that lady is in relation to Shank. I just really hate this story because it feels like no effort was put in the story. That being said i can agree with some people's reviews that the art and animation is pretty good and the setting isnt bad.

So many technical problems with this game. It does not run on a monitor at higher than 60hz. The controls are unresponsive and clunky. Also there is a constant clicking sound while walking that makes this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game unplayable.
The funnest part of this game was putting it into my Steam Library's 'Never Playing Again' category.

Not bad. Not great. Style of the game is sometimes attractive, sometimes irritating. The story did nothing for me, but I'm not a fan of Tarantino or his grindhouse influences that this game was playing off of. Dug the gameplay, even if it's repetitive.
Once you buy this game, you will wonder why you did.
Overall, not terrible, but it's all very repetetive (especially in the boss battles).
